communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Theresa Corley missing person's report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The missing person's report regarding Theresa Corley, Bellingham MA filed on or about December 5, 1978. The log book entries for December 3rd and 4th 1978

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

GERALDINE HOUDE

communications.subject: Re: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Theresa Corley missing person's report
communications.communication:
Good Morning Geraldine,
Per your request listed above; the log of Theresa Corley being reported
missing is attached.  Ms. Corley was reported missing on December 6, 1978.
I also contacted NCIC/CJIS to do an offline search for the TT entry and
they do not go back that far due to the fact of the missing person being
found.  If a person is still missing then the record stays active.
The logs for December 3 and 4 1978 are also attached.
Please let me know if we can be of further assistance.
Best Regards,
Kristin








*Kristin Gutauskas DonovanFranklin Police DepartmentAdministration/Firearms

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2009 film "The Box"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the production of the 2009 movie "The Box," directed by Richard Kelly and starring Cameron Diaz. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for "The Box." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Box," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: OIS - Firearms Discharges
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Incident-level data on Paterson (NJ) Police Department officers’ drawing their weapons/firearms in the course of their duty: I request data from years 2000 to 2020, including the time, date, and street address (e.g. 123 Main St) for all incidents where an officer drew their weapon/firearm;
2) Incident-level data on the Paterson (NJ) Police Department officers’ discharging their weapons/firearms in the course of their duty: I request data from years 2000 to 2020, including the time, date, and street address (e.g. 123 Main St) for all incidents where an officer discharged their firearm;
3) If incident-level data on the Paterson (NJ) Police Department officers’ discharging their firearms in the course of duty from years 2000 to 2020 inclusive is available, I also request associated data on whether the shootings by the officers were lethal (i.e. suspects or civilians died as a result of gunshots from officers’ weapons) or were non-lethal (i.e. suspects or civilians were shot but did not die); and
4) Demographic data on the officers and suspects or civilians involved in each incident of Paterson (NJ) Police Department officers drawing, discharging, and/or striking (lethal and non-lethal) of suspects or civilians.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Owens

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NARA PF 12.13.23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting access to the following records in the possession of the National Archives and Record Administration (NARA):

All records related to Project Fantasia. Project Fantasia was a collaboration between the Office of Strategic Services (record group 226) and the Office of Scientific Research and Development (record group 227), and was assigned a project number of SAC-26. A 2016 article published by NARA in Prologue Magazine, titled "Secret Weapons, Forgotten Sacrifices," contains a description of Project Fantasia and identifies some of the records as being in record group 227. It can be found here: https://www.archives.gov/publications/prologue/2016/spring/office-scientific-research-development-world-war-ii

Please restrict your search for any records to record groups 226 and 227.

I would prefer to review these records in-person, at your location in College Park, Maryland. If any of these records are being held at a facility other than the one in College Park, please notify me of this before processing the request.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please advise which tier of processing queue this request falls under and an estimated time frame for processing.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said destruction or transfer, to include but not be limited to confirmation that NARA has no other copies of said records.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: Re: Freedom of Information Act Request: NARA PF 12.13.23
communications.communication:
This is an automated reply to inform you that the National Archives and Records Administration received your email.  

We have received your request and you will receive a response within 20 working days. Please note that submitting duplicate requests will increase wait times.  

If you have any questions, you can call our office at 301-837-3190. You can also visit our web page at www.archives.gov/research/foia.  


Thank you.

communications.subject: [24-13703]- Freedom of Information Act Request- Robert Skvarla, Jr.
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Skvarla:

This is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request of December
13, 2023, regarding Record Group 226 *Records of the Office of Strategic
Services (OSS) *and Record Group 227 *Records of the Office of Scientific
Research and Development [OSRD]* records pertaining to Project Fantasia
(SAC-26), which was a joint OSS/OSRD project to create a luminescent
balloon as a psychological weapon against the Japanese during World War II.

Your request was received by my office on December 19, 2023 and assigned
tracking number 24-13703.

Using the search terms "Fantasia" and "SAC-26" to guide us, we have
carefully searched the Topical Index and the Code Name Index
for Record Group 226 *Records of the Office of Strategic Services (OSS), *which
references documents held throughout the record group. We also searched the
file list for Record Group 226 Entry A1 145 *Records of the Office of
Strategic Services. Research and Development Branch. Subject Files,
1942–1945*, which developed or contracted for the fabrication of special
weapons and devices. However, we were not able to locate any records
responsive to your FOIA request.

We were able to locate one Project Fantasia (SAC-26)-related file, which is
open to the public and contains approximately 60 pages, in Record Group 227
Entry NC 118 151 *Records of the Office of Scientific Research and
Development. Project or Problem Files, 1942–1946*, Box 74 [STACK LOCATION:
130/22/12/4]. We would be happy to help you access these records in
the Civilian Records Consultation Area of the National Archives at College
Park, MD <https://www.archives.gov/college-park> (Archives II) Textual
Research Room (3rd Floor). You may request an appointment
<https://www.eventbrite.com/cc/textual-research-room-appointments-487599> to
do so online.

As an alternative to visiting Archives II, you may wish to hire a private
researcher to access the records on your behalf.  A list of private
researchers who are familiar with Archives II is available on our website
<https://www.archives.gov/research/hire-help/locations.html?facility=college-park>
.

We do not consider this a denial of your FOIA request. However, if you are
not satisfied with our action, your options for appeal and dispute
resolution are outlined in the attachment.

This completes the processing of your FOIA request.

Sincerely,

ERIC van SLANDER

Textual Reference Archives II Branch (RR2RR)
National Archives at College Park, MD

title: Funding to CDL training programs (Kentucky Department of Transportation)

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Funding to CDL training programs (Kentucky Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting copies of public records regarding the public funding of commercial drivers' license training programs from 01/01/2018 to 12/31/2022. These programs are designed to prepare students to meet the qualifications to become a qualified entry-level commercial truck driver. Funds for these programs were made available through the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act.

Specifically, I request information regarding the following:
- Budget documents for the full date range noted above, including planning documents, proposals, and research reports
- Spending reports
- Communications, including internal emails, press releases, and meeting notes and transcripts, that include the phrase "commercial drivers' license"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rachel Premack

You may appeal this response by filing a complaint with the Office of the Attorney General, Open Records/Open Meetings, The Capitol, 700 Capitol Avenue, Suite 118, Frankfort, KY 40601, pursuant to KRS 61.880, or by filing an original action in Franklin Circuit Court under KRS 61.882. If you first appeal to the Attorney General but are dissatisfied with the Attorney General's decision, you may further appeal to the Franklin Circuit Court pursuant to KRS 61.880(5)."

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, we hereby request the following information:

Your agency name
Your agency state
Your agency type   Business, Education K12, Education Higher
Your agency CEO

Breach is defined for this request as
A: An external actor that forcibly entered the system and accessed information
B: An internal actor that released or shared information that was not appropriate to share or shared intentionally without regard for entity protocol.

Please list any breach that was reported using the following format for the time period July 1, 2021 until July 1, 2023. Label each breach logically as Breach 1 or Breach 2, etc.*List each breach categorized as a document or an email as a separate breach.

For each breach provide the following information
1. Was this event for documents or email?
2. Date breach was reported
3. The position of the person reporting the breach
4. Highest position of  administration the breach was reported to for the agency
5. Was the process or procedure for evaluating and notifying those impacted followed? 
6. Were stakeholders with breached data notified?   If so, what timeline after the breach was reported (weeks, days, hours)  to the CEO listed above was the notification sent to those impacted?
7. What method(s) was used to notify stakeholders of the breach? Example, newspaper, social media, email, phone, mail, etc.
8. Was any protection such as credit monitoring or other protective opportunities provided to stakeholders affected?
9. Was the breached information considered protected under HIPAA or FERPA?
10. Count of records breached for category 1 above. (Emails and documents should NOT be included in the same count but reported as separate events even if the same date)
11. If the agency's process or procedure for evaluating and notification were not followed, what was the reasoning and by whom was the decision made to not follow the process or procedure?

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
FOIA Disclosure Group

Good afternoon,

We are still researching this matter and will need more time to review the information to be able to provide an accurate response. Thank you for your patience.

To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, we hereby request the following information:
Your agency name Union County School District
Your agency state Florida
Your agency type   Business, Education K12, Education Higher Education K-12
Your agency CEO Mike Ripplinger
Breach is defined for this request as
A: An external actor that forcibly entered the system and accessed information
B: An internal actor that released or shared information that was not appropriate to share or shared intentionally without regard for entity protocol.
Please list any breach that was reported using the following format for the time period July 1, 2021 until July 1, 2023. Label each breach logically as Breach 1 or Breach 2, etc.*List each breach categorized as a document or an email as a separate breach.
For each breach provide the following information

1. Was this event for documents or email? 
Breach 1 - Documents - Upon review of the documents reported to some members of the Critical Incident Response Team (CIRT) as a breach, the documents in question were not found to meet the District Incident Response Plan definition of a breach. 
Breach 2 - Emails - Upon review of the emails reported to some members of the Critical Incident Response Team (CIRT) as a breach, these emails in question were not found to meet the District Incident Response Plan definition of a breach.

2. Date breach was reported
Breach 1 - 5/19/2022
Breach 2 - 10/31/2022

3. The position of the person reporting the breach 
Breach 1 - MIS Director
Breach 2 - MIS Director

4. Highest position of administration the breach was reported to for the agency
Breach 1 - Superintendent
Breach 2 - Superintendent

5. Was the process or procedure for evaluating and notifying those impacted followed? 
Breach 1 - MIS Director notified two of the Critical Incident Response team members, however the complete team was not convened because the nature of the documents were not deemed a breach as defined by the District’s IRP.
Breach 2 - MIS Director notified two of the Critical Incident Response team members, however the complete team was not convened because the nature of the emails were not deemed a breach as defined by the District’s IRP.

6. Were stakeholders with breached data notified?   If so, what timeline after the breach was reported (weeks, days, hours)  to the CEO listed above was the notification sent to those impacted?
Breach 1 - No, upon review of the documents and the District’s Incident Response Plan (IRP), these documents were not deemed “critical” by the Superintendent. 
Breach 2 - No, upon review of the documents and the District’s Incident Response Plan (IRP), these documents were not deemed “critical” by the Superintendent. 

7. What method(s) was used to notify stakeholders of the breach? Example, newspaper, social media, email, phone, mail, etc.
Breach 1 - None, due to the understanding of the requirements listed in the Incident Response Plan
Breach 2 - None, due to the understanding of the requirements listed in the Incident Response Plan

8. Was any protection such as credit monitoring or other protective opportunities provided to stakeholders affected?
Breach 1 - The incident did not result in the release of personal information as defined in the District’s IRP 
Breach 2 - The incident did not result in the release of personal information as defined in the District’s IRP 

9. Was the breached information considered protected under HIPAA or FERPA?
Breach 1 - FERPA
Breach 2 - FERPA

10. Count of records breached for category 1 above. (Emails and documents should NOT be included in the same count but reported as separate events even if the same date)
Breach 1 - 1246
Breach 2 - 1067 - This total indicates the number of times the email in question had any type of activity, not necessarily resulting in any type of breach. 

11. If the agency's process or procedure for evaluating and notification were not followed, what was the reasoning and by whom was the decision made to not follow the process or procedure?
Breach 1 - Upon review of the documents and the District’s Incident Response Plan (IRP), these documents were not deemed “critical” by the Superintendent. 
Breach 2 - Upon review of the documents and the District’s Incident Response Plan (IRP), these documents were not deemed “critical” by the Superintendent. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.
Sincerely,
FOIA Disclosure Group

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #20230811

In you CRT (Term from your document), the superintendent is not a member of the team with  the exception of when the HR director can not attend and therefore has no authority to make decisions on individual basis.
It appears the Superintendent violated the process designed to protect the system to legally reporting to stake holders what is required by law on matters that are protected under FERPA.

Amended request
Are the individuals identified in these items listed above still communicating on similar correspondence and how many (email and documents separately) have occurred since the 10/31/2022 date until present date?
Has the CRT been advised of these items?

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #20230822
communications.communication:
After multiple reviews some information in your latest response created  confusion and further need for clarification.  The group wishes to make sure it understands the entity's working document regarding a data breach as it relates to the steps the entity took to resolve the issue.
Initially your response was the CEO unilaterally determined (outside the scope of the entity's process) the events were not critical and the sharing and viewing of protected information was not a breach (Hillsborough Schools just reported an event as a breach where only 250 records were improperly viewed, far less than your entity).

In a recent followup dated August 11, 2023, it was stated the MIS Director at the time, followed up with two members of the critical response team on each event.

1. Please give the name, title and email address of these members that were contacted from the team, the MIS Director's name and email address when the breach occurred , the date they were contacted by the MIS Director and the content of the meeting regarding EACH event. A statement will be requested from these individuals.

2. Please send the names and email addresses of those reported as creating the breach.

3. Also, this is by no means  saying the information is not correct but just wanted to confirm for the official record responded to on August 22, 2023.  As of the date of the second breach reporting, October 31, 2022, the official statement is no other emails or document sharing occurred between the individuals that created the breach after this reporting date.  This is not saying the information is not correct but it seems rare that the email and communications between the individuals involved in the breach ceased on the same day the breach was reported. Is that still the official statement?

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request #Complete
communications.communication:
Thanks so much for your response.

Your  response dated August 11, 2023  and later mentions by name, MIS Coordinator (or Director in other responses from December 4, 2023 response) Lanier Clyatt as the one who met with two members of the team.

In the December 4  2023 response the names and positions of MIS Coordinator and Chris Mecusker, Director of Personnel, were the two that the MIS Coordinator contacted. That is really one member contacted for an opinion on the breach being valid to report to those affected or  are we misunderstanding your response correctly?

Also in the August 11, 2023 response it was stated the Superintendent determined the documents that were categorized as FERPA content was not critical and now the MIS Coordinator or Director that in this same response date was the one that reported it. This is confusing as the MIS Director would have reported it if it was not critical to begin with.

Please  send  this request  below to the members you mentioned.
MIS Coordinator - clyattl@union.k12.fl.us 
Director of Personnel - Mecuskerc@union.k12.fl.us

Request  starts on  next line

You are being included as part of a public records request. 
Your information was obtained from a request sent to your entity regarding a data breach.

Please verify that you as a committee member were contacted regarding these breaches.
If there were any documents, meeting notes or email  regarding this meeting or sharing information regarding these breaches please include them.
Please give the date of the meeting and the location. 

As it stands there were only the MIS Coordinator and Director of Personnel that made the decision that the breaches were not critical. Please state according to the records release how the decision was made and how your CIRT document supported this decision.

You may view the discussion of  the public records request here.
https://www.muckrock.com/foi/union-county-10464/untitled-149460/

Thanks in advance for your assistance.
Freedom of Information Act Disclosure Group

My apologies for the confusion,  former MIS Coordinator, Lanier Clyatt and Director of Personnel, Chris Mecusker, were the only members of the CIRT aware of this incident.

Please see the attachments which include the communications Mr. Mecusker provided regarding the incident. 

Mr. Clyatt is no longer employed with the District. 

The District will not be providing any information that does not already exist in a record as defined by Florida Statute 119.011. By answering questions or providing statements, we are creating a record that does not already exist.

title: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All publicly releasable records held by your agency concerning the incident that occurred on or around March 16, 2014 at the Varner Unit involving inmate Patric Patterson (ADC #107498) and inmate Michael Black, in which Black allegedly assaulted Patterson, including but not limited to:

— Incident report(s), including investigative notes and narrative descriptions
— Chronological record of events
— Property log(s)
— Memorandums, memos, and notes referencing the incident
— All photos, audio, and surveillance video of or concerning the incident, including but not limited to stationary pod footage, handheld camera footage, and other surveillance materials
— ADC policy prohibiting officers from entering the barracks alone

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Nicole Einbinder.

communications.subject: Re: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
I do not handle FOIA requests. I am forwarding your request to Wade Hodge in the Legal Department for response.

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>

communications.subject: FW: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
Sonny Albarado,

The Arkansas Department of Corrections received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request regarding the incident that occurred on March 16, 2014.  According to Ark. Code Ann § 25-19-105(a)(1)(A), FOIA requests can only be made by citizens of the State of Arkansas.  Although you state that you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas in your request, the address that you provided was for MuckRock News and it is not an Arkansas address.  In order for us to proceed, please provide us with a mailing address as proof that you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas.


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act request concerning Patric Patterson
communications.communication:
Sonny Albarado,

"On December 4, 2023, the Arkansas Department of Corrections received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request regarding the incident that occurred on March 16, 2014.  It is uncertain whether you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas; as a result, on December 5, 2023, I sent you an email requesting that you verify whether you are a citizen of the State of Arkansas.  I did not receive a response.  According to Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(1)(A), a request under Arkansas FOIA can only be made by a citizen of the state of Arkansas.  We have no proof that you are a citizen of the state of Arkansas; as a result, we cannot release any requested information and your request is denied.

 

 

Thank you,

LATISHA MEADOWS

Quality Assurance Coordinator

Arkansas Department of Corrections

Phone: 1-501-537-7677

Email: Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov"

I have attached the information that the Arkansas Department of Corrections has regarding the incident on March 16, 2014, that is releasable and responsive to your FOIA request in accordance with Administrative Rule 804.


As far as the policy that was requested, the Department does not have any records that are responsive to that request and is not required to create one in accordance with Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(d)(2)(c).


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@arkansas.gov>

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Number of site visits SBA has done as part of the HUBZone program since 2011
- Number of virtual  HUBZone site visits using tools like Google Earth for the same period
- Costs of  HUBZone site visits by year for the same period

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Marianne Bellotti

communications.subject: FOIA Response for SBA-2019-000560
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We are in receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request that you submitted to the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) on May 13, 2019, and received in our office on May 13, 2019. We have assigned your request tracking number SBA-2019-000560, please use this tracking number when referring to your request in the future.

Please be aware that the FOIA provides a right of access to federal agency records that exist and can be located in agency files. The FOIA does not require agencies to answer questions in response to FOIA requests. However, we will make an exception and process your request.

Item 1: we can provide the number of site visits since 2011 (see attached).
Item 2: no records.
Item 3: this portion of the request has been referred to the Office of the Chief Financial Officer for response.

If you are not satisfied with this action, you may appeal this decision to the Chief, Freedom of Information/Privacy Acts Office, U.S. Small Business Administration, 409 Third St., SW, Washington, DC 20416. You must submit an appeal within 90 calendar days of the date of the notice of denial. Your appeal should contain a copy of this correspondence, a description of the information requested in addition to what was denied, the name and title of the SBA official or employee who denied the request, the reason for the denial, and any other facts you deem appropriate.

The 2007 FOIA amendments created the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) to offer mediation services to resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. Using OGIS services does not affect your right to pursue litigation. You may contact OGIS in any of the following ways:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road - OGIS
College Park, MD 20740-6001
E-mail: ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>
Telephone: 202-741-5770
Toll-free: 1-877-684-6448

Please note that using OGIS services does not affect the timing of filing an appeal with the SBA's FOI/PA Officer.

Thank you for your interest in the Small Business Administration.


v/r

Davida Bobo
Administrative Officer, Operations
Government Contracting and Business Development
U.S. Small Business Administration

davida.bobo@sba.gov<mailto:davida.bobo@sba.gov>

[SBA-Hor-2]

Home Page<http://www.sba.gov/> | Twitter<http://www.twitter.com/sbagov> | Instagram <http://www.instagram.com/sbagov> | Facebook<http://www.facebook.com/sbagov> | YouTube<http://www.youtube.com/sba> | LinkedIn<http://www.linkedin.com/company/us-small-business-administration> | Email Alerts<http://www.sba.gov/updates>

communications.subject: Access to Public Records Act Request: AR23-1923
communications.communication:
Hello,

This will serve as the City of South Bend’s acknowledgement of receipt of your Access to Public Records Act request. Your request will be timely reviewed in conformance with Indiana law. As the City has just received your request, it has not yet had a reasonable opportunity to identify, retrieve, and review the records, if any, that may be responsive to your request. Once it has done so, the City will advise you under separate cover as to whether your request is granted in whole or in part, and of the City’s basis for any portion of your request that is denied. The City may also contact you to clarify the wording of your request if there is any portion that is unclear. If you have any questions while your request is being processed, please feel free to respond to this email or call the Legal Department at (574) 235-9241.

Thank you,


[cid:05cfca6e-4e26-4b7c-97f7-351c8c18eeb5]



City of South Bend

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Organization Chart
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the most up-to-date organization chart for Seattle Parks employees as of the date this request was received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Parks & Recreation :: C155526-100923
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on October 09, 2023 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C155526-100923. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 152999-20436800@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime!
 
Request C155526-100923:  
" To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the most up-to-date organization chart for Seattle Parks employees as of the date this request was received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C155526-100923
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C155526-100923 received on October 09, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV23-C155526-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C155526-100923. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-C155526-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diego Maradona (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents about or concerning Diego Maradona (October 30, 1960 – November 25, 2020). Proof of death is not required since his death this month was widely reported.

Please search the Central Index, cross-reference and ELSUR documents.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alfred Spellman

opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1482466-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: FOIA request (case 21-00021-FR)
communications.communication:
Dear Alfred Spellman,

Pursuant to you recent FOIA request (case 21-00021-FR), I will be forwarding our final determination response via email. We have determined that some of the records contain sensitive information that requires encryption as explained below.

In an effort to better protect information that the Department of Justice (DOJ) maintains about individuals, we have implemented a tool to prevent accidental disclosures of sensitive personally identifiable information (PII). Documents that are responsive to a FOIA or Privacy Act request may contain sensitive PII. To safeguard this information, any email containing sensitive PII will be encrypted. Accordingly, you may receive an alert that that an encrypted message has been delivered to you. Should you receive such an alert, please use the attached instruction to decrypt and save the message. If you have any issues with this process, please reply with the error message received so that we may contact our service desk for support.

V/R
Jason T. Miller
FOIA Analyst II
Freedom of Information and Privacy Act Unit
FOIA and Information Law Section
Drug Enforcement Administration
Desk: (571) 776-3436
Email: Jason.T.Miller2@dea.gov<mailto:Jason.T.Miller2@dea.gov>

[https://intranet13.shpt.sbu.dea.doj.gov/sites/cp/PublishingImages/Pages/DEA-50th-Anniversary-News/50th%20Anniversary%20Email%20Signature%20Block_329x83.png]

PRIVACY ACT NOTICE:  This e-mail (including any attachments herein) may contain personal and privileged information that requires protection in compliance with the Privacy Act of 1974 (5 U.S.C. § 552a).  Any use of this information by anyone other than the intended recipient is prohibited.  If you have received this communication in error, please immediately delete all copies of this information and notify me by e-mail.  The use, dissemination, distribution, or reproduction of this communication by unintended recipients is not authorized and may be unlawful

title: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Information Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past one month (November 11 2023-December 11 2023) regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as "ordinance" in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as "Drug and gang houses, houses of prostitution and other disorderly houses" as described in Sec. 8-4-090 in Chicago's city code.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

title: Use of Force Policy (Lowndes County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy (Lowndes County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All policies, practices, procedures, rules, or orders concerning the use of force.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blake Feldman

communications.subject: Public Records Request
communications.communication:
I am in receipt of your request for policies on the Use of Force from the Lowndes County Sheriff's Office.  Your records are ready and available for pickup.  The records production for a paper copy will be $3.00 and a CD will be $10.00 payable by Cashier's Check.  If postage is required, it will be an additional $10.00 to cover for shipping and handling.  Your request is considered complete and awaiting payment prior to being delivered.

Brent Swan
Chief Deputy
Lowndes County Sheriff's Office
527 MLK Jr. Dr. South
Columbus, MS 39701
Office: 662-328-6788 Ext. 2302
Direct Line: (662) 329-2714
Fax:      (662) 244-0769
bswan@lowndes-so.org<mailto:bswan@lowndes-so.org>

communications.communication: Thanks for your response! If the document cannot be emailed, I would need the document mailed. Am I understanding correctly that the cost of printed records is $3, and I would need to pay an additional $10 to have the document mailed? Or is the $10 fee for shipping and handling only applicable to records production in CD format?

communications.subject: RE: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Use of Force Policy (Lowndes County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication: The cost of the documents is $3.00.  We can put it in U.S. Postal and mail the documents (in a envelope) for an additional $2.50.  If we mail the CD, the cost is $10.00.  The total for paper copies mailed will be $5.50.  Once payment is received, your documents will mail within 24 hours on weekdays.

title: Chicago Department of Water Management Lead Service Line Replacement Programs

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago Department of Water Management Lead Service Line Replacement Programs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

List of addresses in Chicago, in an electronic data table if possible, that have had completed and in-process lead service line replacements as of December 7, 2023 through the:

- Equity Lead Service Line Replacement program
- Homeowner-Initiated Replacement Program
- Daycare Lead Service Line Replacement Program
- Sewer Main Lead Service Line Replacement Program
- Water Main Lead Service Line Replacement Program
- Break & Leaks Lead Service Line Replacement Program
- Through Department of Water Management routine maintenance and repair operations for all years available up to 2023.

If addresses are not available due to privacy reasons, please provide the list anonymized at the block level with accompanying ZIP Code, Community Area, and Ward if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Feliciano Ocegueda

title: Institutional Press Policies (University of Alabama at Birmingham)

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Institutional Press Policies (University of Alabama at Birmingham)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policy, guidance, handbook, manual, or standard contract concerning the institution’s interactions or relationship with members of the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

2. Any policy, guidance, handbook, or manual concerning the interactions or communications of institutional employees, including faculty, administrators, staff, and student employees, with the news media, reporters, or journalists, including but not limited to student journalists. 

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. This request concerns a matter of public interest. The records are sought for the purpose of researching and educating the public about policies affecting student journalists' ability to engage in news gathering and reporting on college and university campuses.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Anne Marie Tamburro.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any FBI files on Daniel Ellsberg. Born April 7, 1931 in Chicago, Illinois, Daniel Ellsberg died June 16, 2023 in Kensington, California. He was America's most famous whistleblower. His death at age 92 was widely reported in the media in June, 2023. He was the husband of the American journalist Patricia Marx Ellsberg. He is also known by the name Dan Ellsberg.

Records relating to or mentioning Daniel Ellsberg. Major media outlets across America as of June 16th, 2023 have reported his death including: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/06/16/daniel-ellsberg-pentagon-papers-dead/ https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/16/us/daniel-ellsberg-dead.html

Please conduct searches of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the SENTINEL system, FBI email system, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, Counter-drug Information Indices System (CIIS), Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW) including but not limited to Investigative Data Warehouse - Secret, IDW-S Core, SPT, and DOCLAB-S, FBI Automated Case Support system (ACS), subset of the Electronic Case File (ECF) system, National Crime Information Center (NCIC), Combined DNA Index System (CODIS), Integrated Automated Fingerprint Identification System (IAFIS), Interstate Photo System (IPS) and/or Facial Recognition Databases such as those used by FACE (Facial Analysis, Comparison, and Evaluation) specialists, and the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) warrant applications and/or Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court (FISC) record filings, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. Please further consult all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other data sources containing potentially-responsive materials related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, investigations, inquiries, audio files, photographs or image files, video files, memos, email systems, directives, network packet captures, meeting minute notes, calendar entries, and any other data or data format that is used by the FBI. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, code names, nicknames, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency or any other agency that is known to the FBI. Please additionally include searches for inter-agency or non-agency communications accessible by the FBI about Daniel Ellsberg.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

It is my understanding that your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, which remain technically under your agency’s control (see 36 CFR 1250.8). Please also conduct a search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for records related to Daniel Ellsberg.

Furthermore, I request the FOIA log and copies of all other requests for information on Daniel Ellsberg including the responsive documents.

Daniel Ellsberg was a public figure. This request is a critical part of a journalistic research project which requires the responsive documents for informing the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Appelbaum

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
Hello,

I am writing to follow up on recent communication regarding my FOIA request regarding Dr. Daniel Ellsberg.

Thank you for sending copies of previously released information about Dr. Daniel Ellsberg in partial fulfillment of FOIPA Request No.: 1596215-000. I see that in the reply that contains these previously released documents, additional records that are responsive to my request exist. I am writing to confirm within the allotted thirty day window that this material does not satisfy my request as most of the documents are more than forty years old, and many are much older. I understand that Dr. Daniel Ellsberg continued to be of interest to the FBI long after the early 1980s. I request that the additional records about my requested subject be processed.

Thank you for your time and assistance in this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596215-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Daniel Ellsberg
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former U.S. military analyst Daniel Ellsberg (April 7, 1931 – June 16, 2023). His death is widely-known and has been widely reported, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. You may find an obituary from NBC News attached below, and a statement by Mr. Ellsberg's son at the following link: https://twitter.com/RobertEllsberg/status/1669776046751899648

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

    137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.
    
    If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to

    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and

    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me

    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fdaniel-ellsberg-147863%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2NfVNjHDTE1Gy_ueXvgrmh4%3A1qB4lf%3AMgOsMtOLjYb5f8AKSEItMIzpnmevTAqBy9sl7GRmrP8

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
Thank you for this partial response. In your letter, you write:

"Please be advised that additional records responsive to your subject exist. If this release of previously processed material does not satisfy your request, you must advise us that you want the additional records processed."

I would like to formally advise that I would like the additional records processed. Please confirm receipt of my request. Thank you again for your prompt attention to this matter.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
The FBI has received your additional correspondence regarding your Freedom of Information/Privacy Act (FOIPA) request and it has been forwarded to the assigned analyst for review and determination.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1596242-000
communications.communication:
Hi,

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Incident Reports Involving Squeegee Workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning incidents involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore, particularly those occurring near major intersections and thoroughfares, for the period of January 2022 to November 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

 I am a student at Tulane University conducting research. 

Sincerely,

Meghan Green
Mgreen16@tulane.edu

communications.subject: Acknowledgement MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
Dear Meghan Green:

This is an acknowledgement of your request below, for public information, submitted to the Document Compliance Unit (“DCU”) of the Baltimore Police Department (“BPD”).  Your request is governed by the Maryland Public Information Act (“PIA”), Maryland Code, General Provisions Article (“GP”), Sections 4-101 et seq.  DCU will process your request promptly.  However, our response may take longer than ten (10) working days, the reasons for which may include the scope of your request, the type and volume of potentially responsive records, and the nature of the search, review, and preparation that is required.  In any event, DCU will respond to your request within thirty (30) days. GP § 4-203.

DCU will contact you with the availability of records and the possible costs associated with this request, as soon as the information is made available by the Custodian of Records.  Likewise, if DCU and/or the Custodian of Records need you to clarify your request, DCU will contact you promptly.
Your request has been assigned to Julie Hallam.  The DCU staff receive overwhelming number of requests a month and we are working diligently to respond to each and every request as quickly as possible. We appreciate your patience; response to document requests may take longer than normal.

Please refer to tracking # MPIA  23-3052 in any subsequent correspondence pertaining to this matter.  All follow up correspondence should be made in writing and submitted to the DCU’s e-mail: DCU@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:DCU@baltimorepolice.org>.



DCU

BPD

communications.subject: RE: Maryland Public Information Act Request #MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Maryland Public Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Nov. 28, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #MPIA 23-3052.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: MPIA 23-3052
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Ms. Green,

On November 28, 2023, you submitted a request for public records to the Document Compliance Unit ("DCU") of the Baltimore Police Department ("BPD"), for:

"Records relating to or mentioning incidents involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore, particularly those occurring near major intersections and thoroughfares, for the period of January 2022 to November 2023."

The Maryland Public Information Act ("PIA"), Annotated Code of Maryland, General Provisions Article, § 4-101, et seq. governs your request. The responsive record(s) are maintained by the Document Compliance Unit, DCU of BPD.

Attached are the CAD and Calls for Service (CFS) for the dates requested January 2022 to November 2023 "involving squeegee workers within the city of Baltimore".

Nothing in this response is intended to indicate that any records sought from BPD exist or to waive any privileges held by BPD. You have a right under the Public Information Act for the Public Access Ombudsman to mediate any disputes arising out of a MPIA request or a judicial review pursuant to General Provisions Article §§ 4-1B-04, 4-362. Please refer to Tracking Number # MPIA 23-3052. in any subsequent correspondence in this matter.


[cid:image001.png@01DA1886.8CD5B130]<http://www.baltimorecity.gov/>
Baltimore Police

Niki Gills
Investigative Specialist
Document Compliance Unit
601 E. Fayette Street
Baltimore, MD  21202
Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org<mailto:Nichola.gills@baltimorepolice.org>

title: Request to NASA for 2016-2020 film collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for 2016-2020 film collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the years 2016-2020. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

https://pal.hq.nasa.gov/ 

Sincerely, 
NASA Public Access Link

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by NASA Public Access Link
communications.communication:
Dear Brett  Carollo, 

Your request was received by NASA Public Access Link. The request was assigned tracking #24-00229-F-HQ. You seek the following: 

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:A list of all the films that the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the years 2016-2020. Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ.Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires. (Date Range for Record Search: From 1/1/2016 To 12/31/2020) 

Please log into your account and review your submission. The application address is https://pal.hq.nasa.gov/. 

Thank you, 
NASA Public Access Link

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00229-F-HQ
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Moore,

Thank you for releasing the Space Act Agreements for these three films. Note that I requested info on all films that NASA participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, between 2016 and 2020. Am I to assume that, during  this period, NASA only signed such agreements with three productions? If there are additional Space Act Agreements with other productions during this period, I would appreciate those as well.

Attached is a list from NASA of entertainment industry productions supported for the years 2006-2015. A similar list for the years 2017-2020 would be appreciated. 

Thank you for your time,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00229-F-HQ
communications.communication:
Good Morning Brett Carollo,

We provided all the records which were responsive to your request. It may be helpful for me to provide some additional information and context. Do you have time for a phone call today? What’s a good number at which to reach you?

Thank you,

Derek Moore

NASA Headquarters, FOIA
202-358-2681

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00229-F-HQ

Derek Moore

communications.communication:
